Description: Letter from Tjaroy's son: in this letter Butehamen writes to the Priest of Hathor and Troop-Commander Shedsuhor, expressing his concern about his father Dhutmose, who is with Shedsuhor in Nubia. The letter comprises eleven lines of hieratic on the recto and a further two on the verso. The address is written on the bottom of the verso; this would have been visible when the letter was folded and sealed into a small package (the cracks in the papyrus are the result of the ancient folds).
Production date: 1072BC (Year 10 0f the 'Renaissance Era' (= Year 28 of Ramses XI))
Curator's comments: Bibliography; J. Černy, 'Late Ramesside Letters', in 'Bibliotheca Aegyptiaca' 9 (Brussels, 1939), no. 29; E.F. Wente, 'Letters from Ancient Egypt' (Atlanta, GA, 1990), no. 317; J.J. Janssen, 'Hieratic Papyri in the British Museum VI; Late Ramesside Letters and Communications' (London, 1991), pls. 33-4. Published in: I. Regulski (ed.), Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt (London 2022), pp. 205-6
Bibliographic references: Parkinson 1999 / Cracking Codes: The Rosetta Stone and Decipherment (73)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139330) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139330)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Displayed in Room 61 from 2001 until 2007 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair - lacunae
